title: How many inches is 4 cm equal to? - Quora

response.answer_text: That depends on the frame of reference but in general and with imperial metric it’s around 1,5748 inches. for example Napoleon is both 5′2″ and 5′6″ but either is only around 170cm I would advice you to use Google or Computational Knowledge Engine in the future both can easily calculate this for, Google might be the better choice here since google can understand more variations and forms of what you want to achieve due to it being geared towards understanding you while wolfram alpha demands proper notation. “4cm in inches” would already make google give you the correct answer without linking to any url

Lots of good answers. Multiply by 1 (with units attached). The identity in question is that an inch is DEFINED as 2.54 cm. So both (1 inch/2.54 cm) == 1 == (2.54 cm/1 inch). You’re converting from cm, so you want the “cm” units to be on the denominator so it will cancel out. 4 cm = 4 cm X 1 = 4 cm X (1 inch/2.54 cm) = 4/2.54 inches. You can do the arithmetic any way you like.
